channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: I frankly can’t believe the iPhone Air is already 33% off – 4 months from launch, Apple's super-thin handset is down to just AU$1,199
item.description: The minimum cost of AU$1,198.80 rivals the price of refurbished iPhone Airs, and Vodafone's plans start at AU$88.95 per month.

item.title: Google and Character.AI negotiate first major settlements in teen chatbot death cases
item.description: The settlements are among the first tied to lawsuits accusing AI companies of harming users.

item.title: GameSir Stuck a Steering Wheel Inside a Controller, and It’s Actually Brilliant
item.description: It provides the feel of being behind the wheel without the massive haul of simulationist gear.

item.title: CES 2026 Really Wants You to Own a Holographic Anime Girlfriend
item.description: Mark this convention down as the Year of the Waifu.

item.title: Exercise Treats Depression as Well as Therapy or Meds, Review Finds
item.description: More research is needed to understand the long-term benefits of exercise on depression, however.

item.title: 5 key rumors about the Samsung Galaxy S26
item.description: I expect we'll see the Samsung Galaxy S26 series in late February, and expect an iterative generation for the flagship phones.

item.title: Disney Plus is getting vertical video
item.description: Disney Plus will be getting a vertical video feed later this year, Disney announced as part of its Global Tech & Data Showcase for advertisers at CES. Based on an interview with Erin Teague, Disney's EVP of product management for Disney Entertainment and ESPN, Deadline reports that vertical video in the app could include "original […]

item.title: Nvidia quietly launches free software update for its AI mini PC which turns it into an external AI accelerator for Apple's MacBook Pro
item.description: Nvidia plans a major software update that will expand DGX Spark’s role in local AI workloads.
